Reviews.Title: “Nice...with hard beds”
Reviews.Author: Melbournite3052
Reviews.Content: This place is cheap and perhaps the best option on the island. When we arrived (from Australia - a long flight, and then a ferry) our room wasn't ready (late afternoon). No big deal, but an indication of service - no offer of a drink while we waited, etc. We wandered around and discovered the food on a stick that was everywhere. The worst thing, for me, was the very hard bed. It was barely different to sleeping on the floor. We asked for a room change but they said all the beds were new - and the same as the one we had. After the first night of fitful sleep, we said we were cold, got an extra doona, and put that under us, so we had a layer of something a bit softer to sleep on. We still didn't sleep very well. The thing is, we had a great time on the island - I liked it much better than the rest of Hong Kong, with its windy little streets, beautiful seafood, and nice walks. But they desperately need to change their mattresses. Also, I didn't care about these things but you might - water damage on the walls, a small and awkward shower.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Tidy !”
Reviews.Author: lungkm
Reviews.Content: 1, Clean and Tidy. 2. Too simple breakfast , may add more option . 3. Stayed in unit far from Reception , and the toilet with bad smell which couldn't' eliminate by detergent . 4. Ground unit may have privacy problem so not open curtain . Over rating is OK !

Reviews.Title: “Best location on the island..!”
Reviews.Author: Andy1pilot
Reviews.Content: On this trip to Hong Kong the decision was made to stay on Cheung Chau Island... It was a welcome change from my normal regular stays in Kowloon, TST or Wan Chai... The island it self exceeded my expectations... I decided to book a room at the B&B as it is only one of 2 places you can easily book in advance on line... I went with what they call "Suite A" at their Tung Wan Road location... They have 2 locations on the island... It was not a suite as most frequent hotel stayers will know, which usually has separate and/or divided living and sleeping areas... Suite A is in fact the 2nd largest room they offer at 250sq.ft and advertised as a 3 person room... It has 1 double bed and a very small single in the same area and does not have a separate living area... Although it does have a small fridge which was good to have... This room would do a family with a small child fine for 1 or 2 nights... Anything more than that or for 3 adults then you might want to look into their "Family Room" which is 450sq.ft with 2 double beds, one single bed and 2 bathrooms... This is advertised as a 4-5 person room but would work great for those that like space or interested in a longer stay for 3+ people..! The room it self was very clean and did the job... On top of the building is a fairly large terrace with tables and chairs... Excellent place to go get take-out and bring back to eat here... Breakfast was included and was basic but good... You have a few choices of how you want your eggs cooked and the meat you want... You also have a choice of orange juice or coffee. The location is great and easy to find from the ferry... Exit the ferry pier and turn right and a quick left... Go straight and in about 1+ minute you will be there... If you continue past the B&B you will be at the beach in about 30 seconds... This part of the island is only 220m wide..! So if you are looking for a place out of the fast paced concrete jungle of Hong Kong as most people know it... Then give this a try..! Phone: (852) 2986 9990 Website: http://www.bbcheungchau.com.hk

Reviews.Title: “Great Hong Kong Escape”
Reviews.Author: GRtravelling
Reviews.Content: Stay 3 nights here as a peaceful alternative to Hong Kong. It was an excellent escape and so easy to get to and from. Had a deluxe room, was small and compact but very clean and functional. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Did some great walking on the island. Best part was the excellent food along the wharf and when the day trippers had left and peace settled in on the island. Very easy to ferry ride in and out of Hong Kong at any hour. Highly recommended escape.

Reviews.Title: “A holiday without the hassle of flying”
Reviews.Author: Cadamom
Reviews.Content: We went to Cheung Chau for a day trip 2 months ago. We enjoyed the beach so much that we decide to go back again but this we stay over-night. I booked the Cheung Chau B&B on the reccomendation of my colleague who is a long time resident of this small island. We love the location of the place. It is just very convenient- 3 mins from the pier and 3 mins from the beach. The staff there are helpful and friendly too. We had Suit A for 2 nights. The room is small but cosy and has a nice walk in shower. Will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyOMildura
Reviews.Content: We had a delux room which was small but clean and comfortable, next time we will go for a suite,

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Grencia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for a weekend. The rates are actually higher than its website says, they explained tat it was because of the Easter holiday. The location is great - just as it says it's 2 mins from the ferry and 2 mins from the Tung Wan beach, and hence it's very convenient to go for some nice food, groceries, and it's close to the hospital too. The Internet connection is good, not many channels on tv. It's a shame tat the windows are all locked so you can't open any of them. Even though there's an aircon, since the bathroom is builtin, you can still smell the mildew and humidity makes you not so comfortable. But I think it's good for the price, and to be honest, what they offer is already much better than many other inns and resorts do at Cheung Chau(after having done a research on reviews on other inns).

Reviews.Title: “Charming little place on the street”
Reviews.Author: Markfennelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Great value and a welcome rest from busy Hong Kong and Macau. Cheung Chau has a feel of a small Greek or Turkish island before they became over commercialised clones of each other. Cheung Chau has a nice beach and relaxing feel and the b&b added to this charm. Good air con and clean rooms if a little small and excellent free wi fi. Good roof terrace above room no 308 made up for lack of balcony. We made our booking direct from UK via email from thier website

Reviews.Title: “Bed & Breakfast, Hong Kong style”
Reviews.Author: zarkhrov
Reviews.Content: A cozy little hotel situated near the Tung Wan Beach (on the opposite end of the Ferry pier, 5 minutes walking distance). Access to the rooms was only through a staircase (no lifts), hence may pose a problem if you carry heavy or large luggage. Stayed in a standard room but was pretty spacious (compared to mainland HK standards). The bathroom/shower stall was a 'luxury' and there was a 'nice' feature installed meant for courting couples but I shall leave you to visit the hotel to find out what it is. Check-in and check-out was prompt and efficient (in the usual HK manner) but the staff may have difficulty conversing in English. Good: Location on Cheung Chau, near to a few 24-hr convenience stores. During my stay, street hawkers near the pier were still selling local snacks even after midnight! Bad: It seems that the wifi connection is only active at the ground floor? I only stayed one night, so did not clarify this with the front desk. Ugly: No bar fridge in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Comfy, and Clean”
Reviews.Author: rdlgoodchild
Reviews.Content: A charming B&B located in an ideal location on Cheung Chau, close to a beach and the ferry pier. Small rooms but kept clean by a friendly staff. Ideal for short stays although we lived comfortably for 12 days. A small but tasty breakfast menu gave a choice of both local and western meals. Also of note was the roof terrace which gives a lovely view over the delightful island of Cheung Chau. Will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little B & B near a fantastic city, HOng Kong”
Reviews.Author: Woodskid
Reviews.Content: The Cheung Chau B & B (also known as the Tung Wan Guest House) is located on one of the Hong Kong Outer Islands (45 min ferry ride). We stayed two nights and found it a great value. Located only some 100 yards from the ferry terminal. The rooms are small but ultra efficient, clean and modern. Breakfast (Western) was minimal but adequate (not a place you would linger over breakfast). But who would want to when there is so much good, cheap, food around and lots to see. There was a night attendant and they happily provided us with a carafe of boiling water early mornings. Cheerful and efficient staff. Overall a great value. Cheung Chau Island is just delightful. You can immerse yourself in an authentic community. The B & B, apparently a novel concept on the island, is a first rate, budget value. Recommended, but be prepared for the tiny rooms. If you can get it, pay for the larger unit. Apparently avoid the island on weekends of HK holidays, when it's very crowded.

HotelInfo.Name: Cheung Chau B & B
HotelInfo.Address: No.12-14 Tung Wan Road, Cheung Chau Outer Island, Hong Kong, China
